title: Exercises: Numbers, Currencies and Digital Money

items.prompt: How do you say 1,000 in English?
Which of these is NOT physical money?
items.explanation: An E-wallet is digital money on a phone or computer.

items.prompt: Match the term with its category.
Complete the sentence: 'The Bitcoin price ___ high today.'
items.explanation: We use 'is' for singular subjects (the price).

items.prompt: Write a very short message (10-20 words) to a friend. Say: 'Hello, the price is 100 dollars.'

items.title: A Visit to the Bank
items.text: Hello! I am at the **bank**. I have 500 **dollars**. I want to change them into **euros**. The **cash** is in my **wallet**. The **teller** is very nice.

vocabularyHelp.definition: A place where you keep your money.
The currency used in the USA.
The currency used in many European countries.
Money in the form of coins or notes.
A small folding case for holding money.
A person who works in a bank and helps customers.

questions.question: Where is the person?
questions.explanation: The text starts with 'I am at the bank'.

questions.question: How much money does the person have?
questions.explanation: The text says 'I have 500 dollars'.

questions.question: What currency does the person want?
questions.explanation: The person wants to 'change them into euros'.

items.title: Online Shopping
items.text: I like **online banking**. I use my **laptop** to buy things. I have an **E-wallet**. I pay for a new **phone**. The price is 800 **pounds**. It is very **fast**.

vocabularyHelp.definition: Managing money using the internet.
A small computer you can carry.
A digital way to store money on a device.
A device used to call people and use apps.
The currency used in the UK.
Moving or happening quickly.

questions.question: What does the person use to buy things?
questions.explanation: The person says 'I use my laptop to buy things'.

questions.question: How much is the phone?
questions.explanation: The text says 'The price is 800 pounds'.

questions.question: Is the payment slow?
questions.explanation: The text says 'It is very fast'.

items.title: Digital Money
items.text: My friend has **Bitcoin**. It is **digital money**. He doesn't have **coins**. He uses an **app**. The **amount** is small. He is a **pioneer**.

vocabularyHelp.definition: A famous type of digital money.
Money that only exists electronically.
Small, round pieces of metal used as money.
A program on a phone or computer.
How much of something there is.
A person who is among the first to use or help develop something new.

questions.question: What does the friend have?
questions.explanation: The text says 'My friend has Bitcoin'.

questions.question: Does he have physical coins?
questions.explanation: The text says 'He doesn't have coins'.

questions.question: What does he use?
questions.explanation: The text says 'He uses an app'.

items.title: Large Numbers in Finance
items.text: The company has **one million** customers. They pay with **credit cards**. The **revenue** is very high. It is **ten thousand** dollars every day. The **accountant** is busy.

vocabularyHelp.definition: The number 1,000,000.
Plastic cards used to buy things now and pay later.
The money a company receives from its business.
The number 10,000.
A person whose job is to keep or inspect financial accounts.

questions.question: How many customers does the company have?
questions.explanation: The text says 'one million customers'.

questions.question: How do they pay?
questions.explanation: The text says 'They pay with credit cards'.

questions.question: How much is the revenue per day?
questions.explanation: The text says 'ten thousand dollars every day'.

items.title: Traveling and Money
items.text: I am **traveling** to London. I need **British pounds**. I go to the **exchange office**. I give them **euros**. They give me **notes**. The **rate** is good.

vocabularyHelp.definition: Going from one place to another.
The currency of the United Kingdom.
A place where you can change one currency for another.
The currency of the European Union.
Paper money.
The value of one currency compared to another.

questions.question: Where is the person going?
questions.explanation: The text says 'I am traveling to London'.

questions.question: What currency does the person need?
questions.explanation: The text says 'I need British pounds'.

questions.question: What does the person give to the exchange office?
questions.explanation: The text says 'I give them euros'.

items.title: A Simple Transaction
items.transcript:
Customer: Hello, I want to pay for this book. It is ten dollars. 
Cashier: Okay. Cash or credit card? 
Customer: Cash, please. Here is a twenty-dollar note. 
Cashier: Thank you. Your change is ten dollars.

vocabularyHelp.definition: To give money for something.
The person you pay in a shop.
The money you get back when you pay more than the price.

questions.question: How much is the book?
questions.explanation: The customer says 'It is ten dollars'.

questions.question: How does the customer pay?
questions.explanation: The customer says 'Cash, please'.

questions.question: How much is the change?
questions.explanation: The cashier says 'Your change is ten dollars'.

items.title: Large Numbers
items.transcript: Speaker: Today, the bank has a big goal. We want to help one hundred thousand people. Last year, we helped fifty thousand people. This is a big increase.

vocabularyHelp.definition: Something you want to achieve.
To become larger in number or amount.

questions.question: What is the new goal?
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'We want to help one hundred thousand people'.

questions.question: How many people did they help last year?
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'Last year, we helped fifty thousand people'.

questions.question: Is the number getting smaller?
questions.explanation: The speaker calls it a 'big increase'.

items.title: Digital Banking Help
items.transcript:
Support: Hello, this is the online banking support. 
User: Hi, I cannot see my E-wallet on my phone. 
Support: Is your app updated? 
User: No, it is an old version. 
Support: Please update the app to see your balance.

vocabularyHelp.definition: Help given by a company to its users.
A particular form of something that is slightly different from other forms.
The amount of money in a bank account.

questions.question: Who is the user talking to?
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'this is the online banking support'.

questions.question: What is the problem?
questions.explanation: The user says 'I cannot see my E-wallet on my phone'.

questions.question: What is the solution?
questions.explanation: The support says 'Please update the app'.

items.title: Currencies in the Office
items.transcript:
Manager: We have customers in Europe and the USA. 
Assistant: Do we use euros or dollars? 
Manager: We use both. For Europe, we use euros. For the USA, we use dollars. Sometimes we use British pounds too.

vocabularyHelp.definition: A person in charge of an office or company.
A person who helps a manager.

questions.question: Where are the customers?
questions.explanation: The manager says 'We have customers in Europe and the USA'.

questions.question: Which currency is used for the USA?
questions.explanation: The manager says 'For the USA, we use dollars'.

questions.question: Is another currency mentioned?
questions.explanation: The manager says 'Sometimes we use British pounds too'.

items.title: Starting a Business
items.transcript:
Entrepreneur: I want to start a company. I need one million dollars. 
Investor: That is a lot of money! What is your business? 
Entrepreneur: I sell digital wallets for phones. 
Investor: Okay, I am interested.

vocabularyHelp.definition: A person who starts a business.
A person who gives money to a business to make more money.
Wanting to know more about something.

questions.question: How much money does the entrepreneur need?
questions.explanation: The entrepreneur says 'I need one million dollars'.

questions.question: What is the business?
questions.explanation: The entrepreneur says 'I sell digital wallets for phones'.

questions.question: Is the investor happy?
questions.explanation: The investor says 'Okay, I am interested'.

items.title: Digital Banking Search
items.instructions: Find 6 words related to digital banking.

items.title: Digital Money Crossword
items.instructions: Complete the crossword with digital terms.

items.title: Physical Money Crossword
items.instructions: Complete the crossword with physical money terms.

items.prompt: How do you say 10,000 in English?
Which of these is digital money?
items.explanation: Bitcoin is a type of digital money.

items.prompt: Complete the sentence: 'I ___ a student of finance.'
What is the currency of the UK?
items.explanation: The UK uses the British Pound.

items.prompt: Where do you manage money online?
Is an E-wallet physical or digital?
What is the symbol for Euro?
What is the symbol for Dollar?
What do you use to pay on a website?
items.explanation: You use a credit card online.

options: A person who manages financial accounts
A person who drives a bus

items.explanation: The Dollar is a traditional currency.
